definition: to go forward/to advance/to go in/to enter/to put in/to submit/to take in/to admit/(math.) base of a number system/classifier for sections in a building or residential compound

pinyin: ji1 jin4 wu3 zhuang1 fen4 zi3

sentences.english: The president's left-of-centre programme threatens to polarise Congress.
sentences.chinese: 总统的激进计划使国会发生了两极分化。

sentences.english: In the past year or so the Radicals have begun to regroup.
sentences.chinese: 过去的几年激进派已经开始重组。

sentences.english: Moderates have displaced the extremists on the committee.
sentences.chinese: 在委员会中，稳健派人士取代了激进派人士。

sentences.english: Militant mineworkers in the Ukraine have voted for a one-day stoppage next month.
sentences.chinese: 乌克兰激进的矿工们已经投票决定下个月罢工一天。

sentences.english: They became radicalised then, but now are incorporated into the system.
sentences.chinese: 他们成了当时激进的，但现在就被纳入该系统。

sentences.english: So I believe in a very progressive tax on income.
sentences.chinese: 所以我更信奉一个非常“激进”的所得税体系。

sentences.english: Is it the government or is it al-Shabab?
sentences.chinese: 是政府还是激进伊斯兰组织青年党？

sentences.english: And so they should, following a torrent of monetary easing.
sentences.chinese: 在一系列激进的宽松货币政策之后，这也本该如此。

sentences.english: Personally, I lean toward the big-bang view.
sentences.chinese: 从个人角度来说，我倾向于激进式观点。

sentences.english: As such, political and social activism was an end in itself.
sentences.chinese: 这样的话，政治和社会激进主义都将自动消亡。

sentences.english: Just as terrorists have taken advantage of the openness of our society to carry out their plots, violent extremists use the internet to radicalize and intimidate.
sentences.chinese: 暴力极端分子利用互联网来实现极端激进和威胁恐吓。

sentences.english: But radical Shi'ite cleric Moqtada al-Sadr, is threatening to torpedo the vote.
sentences.chinese: 但是激进的什叶派教士萨德尔威胁要破坏议会的投票。

sentences.english: It was radical when Fourier wrote it in 1808.
sentences.chinese: 但1808年，傅里叶写下的这句话却显得尤为激进。

sentences.english: This is a somewhat pinkish organization.
sentences.chinese: 这是个有点较为激进的组织。

sentences.english: Jack distinguishes himself with the hoi polloi by his radical opinion on politics.
sentences.chinese: 杰克因怀有激进的政治观点而不同于大众。

sentences.english: Dug activists even disrupted what was to be a placid, respectful funeral for the fallen Moe.
sentences.chinese: 达格族激进分子甚至在莫的肃穆葬礼上挑起骚乱。

definition: to incline to/to prefer/to be prone to
partial towards sth/to prefer/to incline/erroneous tendencies (Leftist or Revisionist deviation)
